columns.text: This exercise requires us to determine the stock selling price for today and tomorrow and prepare a balance sheet.
**Stock Selling Price** refers to the current market price of a share of stock.

Let's identify the given amounts in the problem. 

<center>

| |Amounts | 
|--|--:| 
|Cash |$ 53,700 | 
| Fixed Assets|385,000 | 
| Equity |438,700| 
|Cash Dividend per share |1.30 | 
| No. of Shares Outstanding|14,000 |

Current Stock Price is computed as follows:

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Current Stock Price } &= \dfrac{\text{Equity}}{\text{No. of Shares Outstanding}}\\[10pt]
\end{aligned}$$

Now, we can compute the current stock price of the company using the equation in step 4:

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Current Stock Price } &= \dfrac{\text{Equity}}{\text{No. of Shares Outstanding}}\\[10pt]
&= \dfrac{\text{\$\hspace{5pt}438,700}}{\text{14,000}}\\[10pt]
&=\boxed{\textbf{\$\hspace{5pt}31.34}}\\
\end{aligned}$$

As can be seen, the current stock price of Sinking Ship Corp. is **$31.34.**

Next, we will compute the tomorrow's stock price. It is calculated by deducting the cash dividend per share from the current stock price.


$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{TSP} &= \text{CSP}-{\text{CD per share}}\\[1pt]
\end{aligned}$$

Where:

TSP - Tomorrow's stock price

CSP - Current Stock Price

CD per share - Cash Dividend per share

Now, we can compute the tomorrow's stock price of the company using the equation in step 6:

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{TSP} &= \text{CSP}-{\text{CD per share}}\\[5pt]
&= \text{\$ 31.34}-{\text{1.30}}\\[5pt]
&=\boxed{\textbf{\$\hspace{5pt}30.04}}\\
\end{aligned}$$

Next, we will prepare a balance sheet after the dividends are paid. But before that, let's compute the adjusted balance of each account. First let's compute the cash dividend to be paid. It is calculated by multiply the no. of shares outstanding from the cash dividends per share. 

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Total CD} &= \text{No. of Share Oustanding}\times{\text{CD per share}}\\[10pt]
&= \text{14,000}\times{\text{\$ 1.30}}\\[10pt]
&=\boxed{\text{\$\hspace{5pt}18,200}}\\
\end{aligned}$$

As can be seen, the total cash dividend is $18,200.

Next, we can now compute the adjusted current cash and equity.

<center>

| |Cash | Equity | 
|--|--:|--:| 
| Market Value| $\text{\$ 53,700}$|$\text{\$ 438,700}$ | 
|Cash Dividend |$\underline{\text{18,200}}$ |$\underline{\text{18,200}}$ | 
| Ex-dividend Value| $\underline{\underline{\textbf{\$ 35,500}}}$|  $\underline{\underline{\textbf{\$ 420,500}}}$| 

 
There will be no change in Fixed Assets.

We can now prepare the balance sheet of Sinking Ship Corp.

$$\begin {array}{c}
\textbf{Sinking Ship Corp.}\\
\textbf{Balance Sheet}\\
\end{array}$$
$$\begin {array}{lrr}
\text{Cash}&\$\hspace{5pt}\text{35,550}&&\text{Equity}&\underline{\$\hspace{5pt}\text{420,500}} \\
\text{Fixed Assets}&\underline{\hspace{14pt}\text{385,000}} \\
\text{Total}&\underline{\underline{\$\hspace{5pt}\textbf{420,500}}}&&\text{Total}&\underline{\underline{\$\hspace{5pt}\textbf{420,500}}}\\
\end{array}$$
